metadata.Title: CVE-2020-36318 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In the standard library in Rust before 1.49.0, VecDeque::make_contiguous has a bug that pops the same element more than once under certain condition. This bug could result in a use-after-free or double free.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-36318` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libstd-rust-1.51 - 1.51.0+dfsg1+llvm-1~exp3ubuntu1~18.04.1
rust-gdb - 1.51.0+dfsg1+llvm-1~exp3ubuntu1~18.04.1
rust-lldb - 1.51.0+dfsg1+llvm-1~exp3ubuntu1~18.04.1
rust-src - 1.51.0+dfsg1+llvm-1~exp3ubuntu1~18.04.1
rustc - 1.51.0+dfsg1+llvm-1~exp3ubuntu1~18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: rustc package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.51.0+dfsg1+llvm-1~exp3ubuntu1~18.04.1').
